cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly north-northwest today, then west-northwest toward the northern Yucatan Peninsula Monday, accelerating northwest across the Gulf toward the central Gulf Coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast (likely SE Louisiana or Mississippi)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect from Tulum to Rio Lagartos, Mexico including Cozumel
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, northern Yucatan Peninsula, and the central Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Alabama/Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Breezy to gusty conditions possible late Thursday (up to ~35-40 mph), but tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (<5% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast from Zeta.
weather_observation.rainfall: Moisture from Zeta could bring 1–3 inches of rain to coastal Georgia Thursday–Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk in rain bands as the system’s remnants move across the Southeast.
